Job description

About the Role

Reporting to the Senior Export & Business Development Manager, the successful applicant will be responsible for the implementation of Sales and Marketing activities to the Chinese community in both Australia and mainland China.


Key Areas of Responsibility

  • Development and translation of brand assets into Mandarin
  • Monitor WeChat Accounts, Weibo, Tmall, Taobao, VIP etc.
  • Project management of monthly campaigns for the local and mainland Chinese markets and liaise with relevant agencies to ensure we meet campaign objectives.
  • Day to day contact with Chinese distributors and partners to ensure content is approved and monthly orders are placed.
  • Prepare, maintain and communicate with internal and external stakeholders
  • Prepare brand presentations for Chinese partners and assist in creating new business relationships
  • Attend relevant events/expos in Australia and China as well as providing translation


Requirements

  • Bachelors degree in Marketing, Finance, Business or equivalent
  • Fluent in Mandarin and English - reading/writing/translating
  • 3+ years experience in a Sales, Marketing and/or business environment
  • Understanding and experience with the Daigou community
  • Skincare knowledge would be desirable
  • High level attention to details with the ability to present to senior stakeholders



McPherson's Consumer Products is recognised as an EEO Employer. Please visit our website for more information about our company www.mcpher.com.au.

[

Surveillance Officer

Company Name Laing O'Rourke Company Location Sydney, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 15 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About

The Pacific Complete consortium, comprising two firms with extensive experience in delivering Australia's most complex infrastructure, Laing O'Rourke and Parsons Brinckerhoff, is partnering with the NSW Government's Pacific Highway Office to deliver the Woolgoolga to Ballina upgrade.

Laing O’Rourke is a $6 billion international operation with 50 years of involvement in Australian construction and infrastructure including more than a decade under the Laing O’Rourke banner. The business is currently delivering some of Australia’s most exciting projects across the transport, building construction, defence, airports, mining, civil and social infrastructure sectors. Laing O’Rourke is committed to becoming the recognised leader for innovation and excellence in the construction industry and has twice been named as one of Australia’s Top 10 most innovative businesses by BRW Magazine.

About The Role

Laing O'Rourke is currently recruiting for a Surveillance Officer for Pacific Complete. You will join an expert team to deliver the $4.3b billion Woolgoolga to Ballina Pacific Highway upgrade – Australia's largest regional infrastructure project.

Key Responsibilities

You will be required to monitor construction progress and supervise employees to ensure assigned work within the area conforms to quality and time requirements and stays within planned milestones and budget.

You will have

You will hold a tertiary qualification in engineering preferably certificate III in related discipline along with an intermediate level of experience in the construction field. Essential to this role will be your experience in complex infrastructure/road projects – RMS experience advantageous.

Culture

At Laing O'Rourke we work hard to create an environment that brings out the very best in our people. We believe in building careers amid a safe, connected and innovative culture – not just creating jobs.

We want to equip all our people with the skills they need to be part of a dynamic Engineering Enterprise.

We have our own specialised learning and development programs, providing access to industry-leading learning tools to help every employee acquire the core competencies and skills needed to excel in this fast-changing environment.

We have committed to a number of policies and programs to improve our gender composition, including our industry-leading paid parental leave policy, where the primary carer is entitled to 26 weeks of paid leave, 18 of which are at full pay and eight weeks at half pay.

Laing O'Rourke is committed to achieving a diverse workforce and strongly encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and people from culturally diverse backgrounds.

Seniority Level

Entry level

Industry

  • Construction
  • Civil Engineering
  • Staffing and Recruiting

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Other
  • Information Technology
  • Management

Landscape Architect

Company Name Banyule City Council Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 5 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Our Parks and Gardens Department is looking for a suitably qualified Landscape Architect to join their Open Space Planning Team.

Banyule City has a wealth of open space and parklands including areas of exotic and native vegetation of historical and environmental importance. The department is responsible for the care and development of over 300 parks and reserves, 50 sports field, 144 playgrounds, over 75,000 street trees, extensive shared trail networks, as well as plethora of park furniture and assets that enhance the urban landscape and create a more attractive and liveable environment.

In this role you will provide specialist landscape architecture expertise in the design, development, and maintenance of high quality open space and urban environments in Banyule. You will also assist in the delivery of open space capital works projects in accordance with the Banyule Management System.

To Be Successful You Will Have
  • Extensive experience in landscape and play space design especially in relation to public open space.
  • Several years’ experience in detailed design and documentation, construction and project management.
  • Tertiary qualification in Landscape Architecture or similar discipline.
  • Experience in relevant design software including computer aided design (AutoCAD) and graphics software packages (Adobe Creative Suite).
  • Current Drivers Licence.
  • Well-developed verbal and written communication skills.
  • The ability to supervise others.


We Are Offering
  • Attractive salary $83,080.81 - $90,323.79.
  • Permanent full time 40 hours per week.
  • Access to learning and development opportunities and a range of health and wellbeing initiatives.
  • Based at Parks Office, 268-270 Banksia Street, Bellfield 3081


For more information about this position please access a copy of the position description via the link below or to discuss your suitability, we encourage you to contact Cormac McCarthy Open Space Planning Coordinator on Tel: 03 9490 4413 for a confidential conversation.

To apply for this position, please include your resume and cover letter addressing the Key Selection Criteria outlined in the position description. For more information on how to apply, please refer to the Application Guidelines via the link below.

Applications Close 11.45pm on Monday 17 September 2018

Banyule City Council is a child safe organisation and an equal opportunity employer. Candidates from diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

866904342:
[

Local Director - Business Coaching & Consulting Industry

Company Name Trusted Advisor Network - Canberra Company Location South Coast Mc, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 15 hours ago Number of views 12 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Like to Build Your Own Business Instead of Someone Else’s?


Unique opportunity for ex Corporates, existing Consultants or Business Coaches to step into a key leadership role and grow your own Consulting Business, with the opportunity to mentor new Coaches and Consultants into your Firm.


  • Ideal for those with a strong corporate, management and leadership background looking to build on their past business experience.
  • Work with us to establish your Consulting business then recruit your own team of business consultants to work in your own Firm.
  • Strong income potential: $140k – $350K+


We are currently recruiting Local Directors in the South Coast (Eden to Nowra) region. We are looking for the right people that fit our brand and philosophy for business improvement in the Small Medium Enterprise (SME) sector. \xa0With the right team of Local Directors, we can have a profound influence on the SME business community.


We believe that business development in the SME sector should be accessible, affordable and sustainable to business owners everywhere. \xa0Our experience over the past 16 years in this industry has shown us that the SME sector has been under-serviced with inconsistent, non-existent and often too expensive advice. \xa0Our belief is that business owners need advice that is accountable for its results where those giving the advice can systematically prove Return on Investment for the owner.


As part of our expansion, we are looking for highly committed business people with a passion for helping others. It may be that you have successfully built teams and businesses or you may be an existing coach or consultant who wants to amplify your influence.


This is a self-employment position where we work closely with you to help build your own consulting/coaching business (or expand your existing business). \xa0Then once you’re ready, you’ll have the added opportunity to recruit consultants/coaches to establish your own Firm over time. We provide all initial and on-going training and have a unique set of resources, tools, systems and Coaching Software exclusive to our network of consultants. You’ll also receive in-field training by working closely with your Regional Director (me) to get you launched with clients and established as a local SME consultant. \xa0That’s my role… working along-side you step by step.


Skills & Experience:

  • Like the idea of being involved and assisting the SME business community.
  • Enjoy being part of a team, while also leading teams and individuals.
  • Self-driven with a strong desire to achieve.
  • Motivated to help others and see them succeed.
  • Feel like you still have more you’d like to achieve in your career.
  • Looking for a long-term career option that combines the above.


If this opportunity sounds like something that fits your values, your talents and your passions, tell us about yourself, where you are based and why this position is of interest to you?


For initial contact and expression of interest natalie@trustedadvisor.com.au

866749123:
[

Transport Team Leader

Company Name Cement Australia Company Location Port Kembla, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 18 hours ago Number of views 14 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We have a rare opportunity for a confident and motivated Transport Team Leader to join our Supply Chain & Logistics team based at Port Kembla. Reporting to the Logistics Manager - NSW, you'll lead a team of truck drivers to deliver our products safely and on time to our customers.

No two days will be the same as you work with everyone from customers and allocations to maintenance and service providers to support your team. You'll use your exceptional organisational skills and sound judgement to quickly resolve issues as they arise, anticipate potential risks and juggle those inevitable conflicting priorities. As we introduce new technologies and processes in to the fleet, your confidence in managing change will play a role in their success. With great communication skills and a natural ability to build relationships, you'll quickly make a difference to the NSW team.


As our Transport Team Leader, you will:

  • Ensure compliance with Workplace Health and Safety legislation, company policies and inductions to achieve Zero Harm to the environment and internal and external customers
  • Organise and lead truck drivers to ensure deliveries are performed optimally and on time. Track progress of your assigned fleet and report problems or improvement opportunities regularly to the central planning department.
  • Coach and mentor drivers to maintain a high performing and collaborative team with customer service excellence
  • Identify continuous improvement opportunities and implement best practice in cost management, safety and fleet/workforce management
  • Provide a high quality, cost effective service that exceeds customer expectations and returns nil customer complaints
  • Plan drivers and vehicle availability in advance and update central planning team each day on all shift start times, driver numbers and truck availability as directed.
  • Participate in the daily schedule review meetings to achieve the optimal asset deployment
  • Prepare and deliver regular toolbox meetings with drivers that are engaging and encourage meaningful participation
  • Ensure NSW Road Transport operations comply with all relevant legislation - CoR, NHVAS, BFM, and where necessary organise vehicle services and breakdowns to ensure they meet required legislations
  • Manage labour (LOD, company and contract) to minimise wastage and maximise utilisation

Desired Skills and Experience:

  • Previous experience managing a team of drivers, ideally for a fleet of heavy vehicles in road transport
  • Solid understanding, interpretation and experience with NHVL, CoR, NSW Workplace Health and Safety, and Environment legislation
  • Demonstrated commitment to the practical application and education of safety
  • Experience managing contractors and 3rd party logistics
  • Ability to prioritise workload whilst in a fast pace environment
  • Excellent communication skills with strong leadership capability
  • Ability to work autonomously, operate with sound judgement in a high pressure environment
  • Intermediate or above IT skills with strong Microsoft Office, specifically Excel
  • Demonstrated experience in SAP would be an advantage
  • Basic knowledge and experience in dealing with budgets and cost management

Benefits:

  • Manage a large team of drivers
  • Opportunity to operate autonomously in a team environment
  • Well established supply chain network

As part of the recruitment process you will be required to complete a pre-employment medical and a background check and provide references.

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Building Materials

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Distribution
